## Dataset <span class="invisible-link">[ðŸ”—](#Dataset)</span>

Take care, one cell can contain more than one value. `r emo::ji("warning")`

### **Codebook <span class="invisible-link">[ðŸ”—](#Codebook)</span>**

Each Codebook will later get its own row in the final Excel layout. The Dataset contains one folder with tables; you can merge them by the ID (col1). Under **Section**, you see the corresponding column headers; the sequence should be following "Arbeitsschritt", "Ablauf", "Hilfsmittel".

### **The Layout <span class="invisible-link">[ðŸ”—](#The-Layout)</span>**

The final Layout should contain a:

- Headnote contains: "Standard Operating Procedure" \n Artikel:[articel_number/articel_number_couple]

- Logo on the right top corner

- A Header: Manufacturing of Rawprodukt:[articel_number/articel_number_couple]

- A table of the manufacturing steps.

- A footnote containing: date / name / page

### **The Table-layout <span class="invisible-link">[ðŸ”—](#The-Table-layout)</span>**

- Make an extra row for each manufacturing step (each Codebook).

- The sequence of the manufacturing steps is determined by the Codebook according to the number.

- Above each manufacturing step, there should be a row that contains the column header.
